buginformation.summary: [FELIX-3124] [Framework] Implement OSGi R4.3 property to allow installing bundles with the same BSN and version - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: The OSGi R4.3 spec defines the org.osgi.framework.bsnversion framework configuration property that controls whether installing duplicate BSN/version pairs is an error or not. It supports the values "single" (which is the default and current behavior) or "multiple" (which enables duplicates).

buginformation.summary: [FELIX-3122] [Framework] Implement OSGi R4.3 framework UUID - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: The OSGi R4.3 spec requires that a framework generates a UUID each time it is init'ed. The string value of the UUID is placed in the org.osgi.framework.uuid framework property.

buginformation.summary: [FELIX-3056] [Framework] Implement OSGi R4.3 event listener service registry hook - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: The OSGi R4.3 spec introduces a new service registry hook, called EventListenerHook, which replaces the EventHook. Essentially, it is a more fine-grained version of the EventHook giving you control over precise listeners rather than operating on all listeners from a given bundle.

buginformation.summary: [FELIX-3032] [Framework] Implement OSGi R4.3 bundle hooks - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: The OSGi R4.3 spec introduces a hook mechanism, called bundle hooks, to control which bundles can see other bundles via BundleContext.getBundles() and bundle events. We need to implement this functionality.

buginformation.summary: [FELIX-2999] [Framework] OSGi R4.3 now specifies that number types should be trimmed when evaluating filters - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: Previous specs were not clear how strict or lenient framework implementations should be when coercing types when evaluating filter strings. The Felix framework was strict and did not massage parsed data when coercing types (e.g., trimming string values before coercing them to a number). Now the spec says that the string representation of number types should be trimmed before attempting coercion.

buginformation.summary: [FELIX-2986] [Framework] Implement OSGi R4.3 resolver hooks - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: The OSGi R4.3 specification introduces resolver hooks to impact how the resolver resolves bundle dependencies.

buginformation.summary: [FELIX-2975] [Framework] Implement OSGi R4.3 framework start level object - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: The OSGi R4.3 spec deprecates the StartLevel service. It is replaced by two new interfaces, FrameworkStartLevel and BundleStartLevel, which are available from the new Bundle.adapt() method. The functionality is equivalent to the StartLevel service, this is just a new way to access it.

buginformation.summary: [FELIX-2973] [Framework] Implement OSGi R4.3 generic capabilities and requirements - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: The OSGi R4.3 spec introduces a generic mechanism for a bundle to provide some capability (Provide-Capability) and other bundles to require such capabilities (Require-Capability). We need to implement this feature. Since it is based on the existing model used by the Felix framework, this should be reasonably straightforward. The biggest changes are the support of specifying types in the manifest header for capabilities and that generic capabilities can express "uses" constraints on packages.

buginformation.summary: [FELIX-2969] [Framework] Implement OSGi R4.3 framework wiring object - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: The OSGi R4.3 spec introduces a new FrameworkWiring API available from the system bundle adapt() method to replace the PackageAdmin service. We need to implement it.

buginformation.summary: [FELIX-2959] [Framework] Implement OSGi R4.3 class loader byte-code weaving hook - ASF JIRA
buginformation.description: Implement the OSGi R4.3 specification's new class loading hook to enable byte code weaving.
